newsitem.title: UK: NWE fuel oil - HS thin, barges down on slow demand.
newsitem.headline: NWE fuel oil - HS thin, barges down on slow demand.

text.p: Fuel oil was steady in NWE with the Mediterranean showing only slightly higher trading activity.
High sulphur fuel barges were knocked lower on Tuesday with $123 and $124 fob ARA traded from Monday's $127-128.

"There has not been enough bunker demand to keep prices firm. It is very quiet," said one barge trader. Dealers said prices could still recover if shipper enquiries pick up tomorrow although there was seen to be some pressure to shift material before November.
High sulphur cracked cargoes were still balanced, but no trade was heard and prices looked steady at $116-118 fob NWE.
Dealers said the market was thinly offered set against muted interest. "People want to buy, but they are not desparate yet," said a broker.

Low sulphur material was looking less bullish."You can't sell the stuff," said one trader. Prices were steady to softer with the continued absence of the main Med buyer until around November 10 because of port congestion. Offers were at $137.50 cif Italy, in line with current swaps numbers.
